alert.note: Alert for Deaf Smith; Randall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 14 at 9:22PM CDT until July 14 at 10:30PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN RANDALL AND EASTERN DEAF SMITH COUNTIES... At 922 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 10 miles southeast of Simms, or 11 miles northwest of Hereford, moving south at 10 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to roofs, siding, and trees is possible. Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Locations impacted include... Hereford, Umbarger, Bootleg, Buffalo Lake, Dawn and Simms. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
